Even the honey squeeze bottle had a bit cut off its nozzle so a better tream could be squeezed out, and that's a rare sight in MY book!!! I'm a believer now and have found my Bernal Heights spot to eat and snack!

Monday, 23 Feb 2009 = I've been here several times since my first review was written and the service, cleanliness and great chai teas and food in general hasn't changed! I go here each and everytime I am in the area, which is at least once weekly to deliver my sister to her neighborhood medical appt.
author: Tony L.

description: This is a great little spot to enjoy a healthy breakfast or lunch.  I especially like the Mediterrean platter as it has a perfect mix of med. treats and is as healthy as can be.  The food is consistently good.  The service is also consistently friendly and prompt.  Perfect stop for a quick meal.
author: Camden S.

description:
i have been eating at this neighborhood joint for 5 + years.
Its one of my absolute favorites.

Breakfast is fabulous...its family owned with a family vibe and friendly faces.  They have a couple of little tables on the sidewalk.  Their coffee is great...They offer American Breakfast, Greek, they serve crepes, and burgers, and falafel, and so many other wonderful treats.

Moonlight will always have a special place in my heart.

Oh did I mention they bust they're boombox out on the weekends ...beatles, bob marley...just fantastic!

Cheers moonlight!
author: Ariane M.

description:
3.5 Stars: Just your typical cafe in Bernal Heights that serves your basic breakfast and lunch. Nothing fancy or adventurous on the menu. Though it is a dine-in cafe, you order your food first at the counter, then when your food is ready, they call your number and you get it yourself.

I do have to say that it is the most reliable place on Cortland Avenue to get breakfast. However, it can get pretty crowded during the weekend mornings and you'll feel rushed at times (because of all these people standing around you waiting for a table).
author: Zell C.

description:
The food here is gooooooood.  Every time I go here everything is always really tasty.  Fresh squeezed OJ is good too.  

If I remember correctly, they don't accept cards, but have an ATM inside (not sure if my memory is referring to the right place).  

In my opinion, breakfast prices are a teeny bit high, but portion size and great taste probably make up for it.
author: Levi B.

description: Nothing more than an average, local morning cafe.  I got the lox and bagel and the brine that the capers are kept in was one of the dominating tastes...that shouldn't happen.  I live in the area, but I wouldn't go back again.
author: AJ K.

description: I have been here a couple times. It is across from my house. I'm going to say its OK. Not the best, but good for what you pay for. Fairly inexpensive. They do have fresh squeezed OJ which is kind of amazing :)
author: Jessica S.

description: Really? $8 for a tuna melt and I don't even get a pickle? There's not even any celery or capers or anything in the tuna. You just opened a can of tuna and stuck it between two slices of cheese and some bread. You should be ashamed of charging so much for so little.
author: Georgia F.

description: very friendly people, lots of food and drink options.  easy place to hang out if you need a cafe for the day. food is fine though, not too impressive.
author: Caroline C.

description: Amazing food, very friendly service. This little cafe has grown over the years both in size and skill. The food gets better and the service is still very warm and fun. Check it out the next time your craving a specialty crepe!
author: Chris R.

description: Stopped in for a ginger lemonade yesterday, and as always it was the refreshing drink of perfection.  Bonus: Sam, the owner, was there, and he made it himself.
author: Linda G.

description: Best service in Bernal Heights and consistently good healthy breakfast options with fast and friendly service. The place gets crowded on the weekends after 11:00 a.m. so come early and be prepared to eat well.
author: P A.

description: I had the BLT sandwich it was good and my wife had the banana strawberry and nutella crepes and she said it's too chocolatey
author: Delfin D.

description: I had gone by this place many times and after being done with a standing morning appointment,  in the neighborhood, I decided to have a late breakfast here.  I ordered pancakes with a side of potatoes with a cup of coffee.  The pancakes were fluffy and not too big and a very generous portion of seasoned, red potatoes, which were flavorful.  The coffee was strong, which is exactly what I needed.  The service was friendly and you get your money's worth with the portions of food being generous and the prices reasonable.
author: Carlos C.

description: Lunch with my sister before pedicure.  Fast, good service and good food.  Great place to have quick breakfast or lunch.  My BLT was perfect and the bacon was crispy but not greasy.
author: Wendy C.

description: I've been coming here since I moved to Bernal about 5 years ago. It's bigger than it used to be.Sometimes it takes a while for the orders to come out, especially if you have a few peeps with you.The owner is great.The Breakfast Pocket is my best friend.They usually do sausage or bacon in it, but I always special request diced ham & they are pleased to change it for me.Cash only used to be a problem, but they now have an ATM, so that makes it all better.Also love the Burgers, and my son , who is a huge potato lover can't eat enough of those fries!!!!
author: Ellice D.

description: For breakfast this place just seemed average. If I pay $9 (cash) for an omelet, I want it to be damn tasty. I want my potatoes to be crispy and flavorful. My spanish omelet was just okay- not something that I couldn't do myself with random fridge items & the potatoes seemed bland.
author: Chrissy L.

description: They fixed the seating and there's plenty now. They've also done it up really nicely with some pretty murals on the wall. And the food, as always, is good consistent quality.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Moonlight cafe is everyhing I want and need on a Sunday morning. While I have not explored too much of the menu, I have identified a staple item that I look forward to every Sunday morning (hangover or not)...the "breakfast in a pocket". The concept is simple - regular white pita, soft and supple (oooh, i really hate using that word, but it's necessary here) stuffed with eggs scrambled with your choice of bacon or sausage and cheese. I personally go for the bacon with cheddar...and then go the extra mile...that's right...the SIDE OF CREAM CHEESE. (Damn, I am salivating) The folks there save me the pang of greed I feel when ordering my sinful side, and just include it next to my
perfect pocket everytime I order. Yet another reason to love the moonlight cafe. Always kind, consistently yummy, and great neighborhood atmosphere. My only hesitation in filling that fifth star is that their only available hot sauce is Tabasco...would much prefer Tapatio.
author: Jessa B.

description: A nice little place to get some crepes .... though they taste more like a thin omelet. The potatoes are kickin', and the salad though a bit tart is pretty good and healthy.  Love the ice tea ... but a refill should be in order. Not too busy and on hot days the windows open and sidewalk seating is the norm.... thanks Moonlight for being clean, comfortable, and A-OK!
author: Mark B.

description: I like this place.  Great neighborhood breakfast/lunch joint.  Really tasty breakfast pita with eggs and sausage.  Good crepes, good coffee and really friendly owner.  I'd give this a 3.5 stars if I could only becuase it is slightly (maybe 1.00) over-priced.  Very glad it's here though and the new remodeling is fabulous.
author: Aeon G.

description: Best (and only) no frills breakfast in Bernal Heights. Superior service and consistent preparation. Since its expansion earlier this year, and perhaps some increased word of mouth, bernalites now compete with migrants for table space at peak weekend hours.
author: j h.

description:
This place is your basic, honest breakfast/lunch place with mostly great fast service.  I have personally eaten there a lot and like the owners and other folks who work there.  The eggs are made to order and the coffee is decent.  Plus I find/found it gives you a lot of food and their turkey burgers are some of the best.  I think the father and son who run the place go out of their way to make the place work very well.  

The desserts are totally boring and the musics is loud and really sucks.

Otherwise I'm a big fan.

By the way all of you folks who bitch about bringing in your own drinks to a business establishment are rude and dumb.  Coffee and other drinks are the way restaurants make a slim profit a little bigger.  Why should you bring in something you bought somewhere else?  Get a life. Over 90% of places go out of business in 1-2 years because it's hard to make a go of it in the food service industry.
author: S.C. H.

description: My friends dad owns the place so once again i'm a little biased. Yummu yummy samiches. I had the grilled chicken the other day, it was simple a delish. Their friens are good and you get alot. I took off one star because there was no changing table in the bathroom. I know us woman with children are taking over the world but can you at least provide a tine table or something?
author: Angelina M.

description:
Edited to add:
We have given Moonlight a few more chances and decided that we will not be going back...ever. The service and quality are just horrible. I'm sorry it took me 5+ trips to figure that out. Also be forewarned, it's stroller patrol and super kid friendly, dont be surprised to have several screaming children sitting next to you while you try to enjoy your brunch.

Original review below:
Dear Moonlight Cafe....Bite me!!
Seriously I am super pissed off at this place. It has the potential to be such a great little cafe but obviously the management don't care about the employees or the customers.
First off, for what it is its overpriced. You cant charge those prices and serve mediocre food, you just cant. 
Second the service is lackadaisical at best.
On my first trip there my meal (basic crepe and a latte) took forever but was ok, it wasnt great but it was edible.
On my second trip my meal (a bagel) took way too long, honestly how long does it take to toast a bagel????? Not only that but people who ordered AFTER us received their food first. WTH????
When my bagel arrived I was surprised to see the worlds smallest bagel. It was an insult to decent bagels everywhere. It was almost comical in its puniness.
This place is just crappy and I will never go there again. Its too bad since its in my neighborhood and I love crepes. Oh well, all we can hope is that it gets sold to someone who actually cares about serving decent food. And if the owner reads this, maybe you should consider hiring another person during your lunch rush so it doesnt take 30 minutes to get a freaking bagel and while you are at it, try gettting some BAGEL sized bagels!!!!!
Price: overrpiced for what it is but overall relatively cheap
Ambience: nonexistant
Decor: laughable
Cleanliness: decent
Food: mediocre
author: Catty C.

description: Let me start off by saying that I really like the friendly, casual atmosphere here and to top it off the food is good.  Definitely a dependable place to go for a quick, tasty breakfast.  I love the breakfast croissant and the breakfast pocket.  The coffee is good too!  (Hey, I like Martha's too but let's be rational Martha's fans ... do you bring your own cocktails when you go out to dinner?).  My dad even likes this place over Savor in Noe Valley.  For me, it depends on what type of breakfast dining experience I'm in the mood for.  Moonlight is the best when it comes to grabbing a simple, on-the-go, no nonsense, hot meal in the morning.
author: Julie D.

description: I love this place! Talk about service with a smile. Their crepes are good (although I can't imagine really messing up a crepe) and their coffee is tasty. They have a delicious lavendar lemonade and their med platter is killer. It warms my heart whenever I see their funky little sign.
author: Maya S.

description: Great during the weekdays because it doesn't get so crowded unlike the weekends.  Newly remodeled, it has lots of space and more tables for people to enjoy their Sunday brunch.  They have crepes, omelets, breakfast combos (which are my favorite), a veggie menu, sandwiches and burgers.  The staff always greet you with a smile and are always friendly!
author: Mel P.

description: I love this place! It is two blocks from my house and I go religiously each weekend for their short stack of pancakes and coffee. I disagree with others about the coffee review. I love their espresso and find the neighboring martha's to be rather bitter. The service is friendly - I'm always greeted warmly by staff and the server knows me by name. I recommend the pancakes (obviously) and also their BLT is great! I think their crepes are essentially the same as crepevine, or others like that. I'm not a big crepe fan so don't really have much to say on that.
author: Suzi S.

description: Utterly gross.  This place would be acceptable if you are on a road trip somewhere in the middle of the country and stop off at the local greasy spoon diner.   Rubbery pancakes, hash browns taste of bouillon cubes, etc.  Never again.
author: Goldie S.

description: I agree with Michael E., it's totally similar to the Crepevines and Squat & Gobbles, but with a smaller menu. Unless you happen to be in the Bernal Heights neighborhood, I wouldn't trek across the city (or Bay) to Moonlight. The food and prices are fairly reasonable, at least $10 per person. What I've enjoyed so far is their Port Wine Cheese Burger, Fries, and a glass of Ginger Lemonade.
author: Leroid D.

description: For an unseasonably beautiful November morning here in San Francisco, it was time to dine al fresco for Sunday breakfast.  My dad thinks it's the "Earthquake Weather," but who's checking.  I drove up Cortland Ave. in Bernal Heights and used my parking karma on a spot near St. Kevin's Church.  How lucky!  The place is full of locals, families, some out of towners...good vibe.  The eggs benedict was perfect and the hollandaise sauce wasn't runny.  The potatoes were brown and not burnt and was served timely.  Only the coffee wasn't up the snuff; I would suggest going across the street for a bold cup.  The joint is family owned and the crowd is what you would expect in this neighborhood (very neighborly).  I am not bashing the Visitacion Valley folk in my 'hood, but this was a very nice place to have breakfast on a warm Sunday morning.  It's family friendly, too. I will be back.
author: Tony L.

description: On my way out the door this morning and paid 8 bucks for a mug of tea and french toast. The guy behind the counter was really nice and for that I gave a more generous rating. However, the french toast was only borderline okay, and it didn't have very much flavor. Probably not coming back .
author: Adam P.

description:
my great ex boyfriend Gabe lives in Bernal Heights, and I remember the first time i spent the night he took me there in the morning .I was half dead from hangoverness, and me and him and his roomate Edgar trekked up the hill to the moonlight cafe. 

its a cute little breakfast place, everything in bernal heights is cute do you notice that? nothing is off the hook amazing,its a total breakfast vibe, i remember my omelete being yummz.

i miss that summer of 05, it was really fun
author: Lauren V.

description: They're breakfast food is great! I love the toasted bagel with cream cheese, sun dried tomatos and cucumbers. and they're crapes are good too. Everything made to order and they're coffee is good, too.
author: Kelly Marie C.

description: Usually considered a breakfast joint, these guys actually make the best burger in town. Go for the bacon...
author: Gordon L.

description: i am reviewing this mostly based on service because i've only been here one time so far.  not that the food wasn't delicious!!!  it was perfect.  exactly perfect--my friend and i walked in and wanted a sandwich on a pita (their pita is magnificent) with falafel, hummus, avocado and grilled eggplant.  it wasn't on the menu but the man behind the counter said it was absolutely no problem, made it up immediately, charged us fairly and was extremely pleasant about it all.  this place is a few blocks from our final destination, which was maggie mudd's, so i know we'll be back soon.
author: kate s.

description: Went here because the line at Liberty was spilling down the street.  While the staff was super nice, the food was just bad across the board... between our omlette, hash browns, sausage, turkey burger & fries, we didn't like any of them.  Plus, they messed up our order, took forever for the food to arrive and it was definitely pricey for what you got .  Just kinda blah.  Two stars because I wanted to like it... and the staff really was nice.  As an aside... do all the breakfast spots in town that serve omlettes and crepes have the same people draw up their colorful-menus-on-a-chalkboard (i.e. gobble & squat, crepe 'n coffee, etc.)?
author: Ken H.

description: We go here regularly and think it's a fine place for what it is.  They have a wide variety on the menu, prices are very reasonable, and the staff is friendly -- especially if you're a regular.  The ambiance is nothing fancy, but it's a good basic cafe.
author: Andi T.

description: Kind of Crepevine-like breakfast spot.  Good for a quick breakfast.  Portions are decent and prices are reasonable.  They are very anal though about no outside drinks.  They should work on their coffee then!  Closes early.
author: Michael E.

description: Reliably good.  Not infrequently we find ourselves here. It might be that there are tables outside so we can munch with our pooch.  It might be that the owner takes a very personal interest each time we are there.  Perhaps, that the latte, tea and steamed milk with vanilla that we can count on to be good; whatever it is, we find Moonlight on a tight rotation.  My son loves the pancakes and the way the owner will bring our doxie a biscuit.  I love that whether I want a quick bagel or a more substantial scramble I can count on Moonlight to provide it with local-owned charm.
author: Gwen E.

description:
The crepes were decent, but their sandwiches, especially their pastrami and philly cheese steak are downright embarrassing.  Their french fries come straight out of the costco frozen foods section and are downright disgusting.  Their prices are outrageous considering the quality of the food.  

The crepes keep this place from getting one star, but everything else is bad news cat.
author: Brendan R.

description:
I've eaten here a few times.  The place has fairly good breakfast, it's a bit over priced, but was willing to forgo that because it is so close to my house.  

Today, I discovered that the Eggs Benedict does not come with toast--never mind the fact that it is on the menu immediately above the words "all breakfasts above are served with potatoes and toast."  I first mentioned this to the guy that had place my plate on the counter, but he told m that the Eggs Benedict doesn't come with toast.  Manager / owner guy was at the counter, and I asked him why it doesn't come with toast when, according to the menu, it clearly does.   He said that the biscuits that are part of the Eggs Benedict counted as toast.  What?  I told him that I disagreed and I felt like I was owed some toast.  He asked me what kind of toast I wanted, I told him rye.  Then, when the toast came he attempted to charge me $1.75 for the toast.   I refused on principal.

I'm not going to cry over toast, but I am going to complain at the manager guy's terrible customer service.  For the two cents the toast cost him and a menu that was corrected the next time I ate there, he could have earned a loyal customer.  Instead, he earned this review and has lost a customer.
author: David L.

description: Moonlight has grown on me because you can get a good breakfast/brunch without all the bullshit San Francisco waiting for a good breakfast/brunch. Coffee? No. Go to Martha's.
author: Scott M.

description: This place is ok.  Food and service are pretty average.  Mainly just like squat and gobble.
author: Alex E.

description:
Moonlight Cafe is the perfect neighborhood spot. Yummy breakfast dishes are available all day, and great lunches satisfy those looking for hardier fare. They have options for vegans and vegetarians as well. It's hard for me to move beyond the basic crepe, but I do love the Mediterranean plate and the fab burgers my husband orders.

I love their coffee, dark and hot, and they've just gotten a beer and wine license that lets them serve mimosas with fresh o.j. and a fascinating variety of wine cocktails.

But just as important are the staff and the customers. Sam and Aziz, the owners, work many shifts, greeting regulars by name, ready with their orders. The small tables are easily reconfigured to move together when a friend drops by, and when I walk my dog, I can sit outside with him as I sip my coffee.

Drop by for a lovely, restful time, a quiet read or pleasant chat with friends.
author: H P.

description: Really delicious breakfast this morning!  And cheaper than brunch in Boston or Cambridge, MA (my erstwhile home).  Staff really nice and you can tell that cooking good food and being friendly to neighbors and strangers is important to them.  Spectacular bacon--rarely is bacon perfectly balanced between crispy and chewy.  If I had one _tiny_ critique, it would be the syrup--real maple syrup does so much more for pancakes, french toast, or anything else.  I should have thought to bring my own, like Jerry in the episode with Courtney Cox.
author: Dan E.

description: Extrememly friendly service adjusting any order exactly how you want it. Wonderful bread for a chicken breast sandwhich. Definite must if you want a solid sandwhich, cold or hot, or breakfast.
author: S F.

description: I really like this place. Their breakfast choices are good and I like the falafel sandwiches. The staff is also very friendly and treat customers well. The only problem I have is the price -- it's a bit on the expensive side for what they offer, but I do keep coming back.
author: Dawn M.

description: I'm a pretty generous rater in my opinion but three stars is all i can give to this cafe.  The menu looks phenomenal and has all of my favorite things...avocados, sun dried tomatoes, hummus, salmon, spinach, etc. but when i got the yummiest sounding bagel they had it was a let down. I went with two friends who both ordered similarly simple things and it took 30 minutes to get our food. I might have been less judgmental had my simple bagel taken 10 mins, which is the time it would have taken me to make it myself. We ordered to eat in, and suffered the consequences. Everyone that came after us and ordered "to go" got their food in a jiffy...
author: Laura C.

description: I just love my local cafe. Service cannot be any friendlier and I love their food. We go here at least twice a month with the kids and I always order the Philly cheesesteak sandwich, that is my favorite cheesesteak sandwich in town -both the beef and chicken one. The food is great for what it is: affordable, fast, cafe fare, + the great service and flexibility makes them a 5 star place for me, no doubt.
author: carmen c.

description: quick, good service from super friendly staff and owner! great breakfast crepes with side salad. amazing grilled chicken sandwich. really crunchy yummy bacon on BLTs. good fries! awesome chicken caesar salad. Wonderful, nutty coffee. i think it's the best coffee in SF. really. sidewalk seating is great in nice weather! and again, good coffee, and nice hearty-sized mugs of various colors and types!
author: lesley f.

description: A great spot for breakfast or lunch. The crepes are terrific. Reasonably priced, good food
author: Lauren B.

description: decent tasting chicken pesto crepe.  the salad and potatoes that came along with were a little sub par.  i had to run to martha bros for coffee and then noticed a sign that said "absolutely no outside food or drink".  this could only mean that their coffee sucks and it was a standard thing to go across the street for something better!  i got a few stink eyes for bringing it in anyway...
author: Robert S.

description: i have had many a lunch here and it never disappoints. try one of the middle eastern dishes or maza plates. the food is filling but not too greasy and their soups are always homemade. also, the owner is a real sweetheart and seems to pride himself on being a member of the community and not just a merchant...
author: Marcy S.

description: I like this local place, but had the worst -- and  not cheap! -- breakfast I've had out recently. Everything was undercooked or overcooked. The food had no real taste.
author: birdy f.
